special_cp.overview: Ninetales's has 2577 max CP (at Level 50). A Ninetales obtained from Raids can be encountered from 1235 CP to 1302 CP, or if weather boosted, in the 1544 CP to 1628 CP range. In Field and Special Research, Ninetales can be found in the 926 CP to 977 CP range.
more_info: Field and Special Research encounters are always Level 15. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Field Research encounters have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Pok√©mon hatched from Eggs are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Egg Hatches have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Raid Bosses caught without weather boost are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.

Raid Bosses caught with weather boost are always Level 25. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Weather boosted Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
Wild encounters range from Level 1 to Level 30 Pok√©mon. Their IVs range from 0 (min) to 15 (max) for each stat.

Weather Boosted wild Pok√©mon encounters get a 5 Level boost, bringing their Level range to Level 6 to Level 35. In addition, they have a guaraneed minimum IV value of 4 for each stat, resulting in a 4/4/4 IV floor.

meta_analysis: Ninetales in the meta PvE Analysis ‚öîÔ∏è Raids ‚Äì While Ninetales is a fully evolved Fire-type Pok√©mon, it shouldn‚Äôt be your first choice as a Fire-type raid attacker . Ninetales is more of a balanced Pok√©mon , with its defense and stamina being higher than its attack stats . As such, Ninetales is a bit underwhelming as a raid attacker , with a mere 12.88 points in DPS . Nevertheless, if you‚Äôre lacking in better alternatives for Fire-type damage , you could rely on Ninetales . As a Fire-type raid attacker running Fire Spin and Weather Ball , Ninetales is strong against Bug , Steel , Grass , and Ice-types . üîÆ Dynamax ‚Äì N/A PvP Analysis üîµ Great League ‚Äì Ninetales is a solid Pok√©mon for the Great League . It has balanced stats . Not only that, Ninetales also has access to Fire Spin as a fast attack , which is a decent, balanced option. As for charged attacks , you have quite a few options: Weather Ball for Fire-type spam , but for heavy damage, you have Overheat , which is the common choice, or the legacy moves of Flamethrower or Fire Blast if you want to try them out. If you want more coverage, you can even run Scorching Sands instead. Unfortunately, that‚Äôs also where the problems start. Ninetales is a pure Fire-type with Scorching Sands being its only coverage. As such, you don‚Äôt see it as much in the main meta as some of the other Fire-types . However, it is still very solid and can work really well as a spice/limited meta choice . üü° Ultra League ‚Äì Ninetales is even better for the Ultra League . For starters, it has much better stats for this league. With a base stat total of 4101 , Ninetales‚Äô stats are higher than some of the best Pok√©mon in the Ultra League . Not only that, Ninetales has more targets in this league as well. Ninetales , as a Fire-type , can deal super-effective damage against dominant Steel-types such as Registeel and Steelix , and it also resists Fairy-type attacks . If you opt for Scorching Sands as one of your charged attacks , you can deal with many Poison-types as well. üü£ Master League ‚Äì With a max CP of 2577 , Ninetales is not a good fit for the legendary-dominated Master League . mega_boost.title: Mega Pok√©mon that boost Ninetales
mega_boost.intro_text: A list of Mega Pok√©mon that boost Ninetales's Fire-type moves, Candy, and Candy XL from catching Ninetales.

bonus_info.raid_bonus: Mega and Primal Raid Bonus ‚Äì Mega Pok√©mon boost the attack power of all other Pok√©mon when battling in Raid Battles by 10%. Attacks that share their type with the Mega Pok√©mon's type(s) receive a 30% boost. However, these bonuses do not stack if there are multiple Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon battling simultaneously; only the higher boost will be applied.
bonus_info.catch_bonus: Mega and Primal Catch Bonus ‚Äì While a Pok√©mon is Mega-Evolved, additional XP and Candy is granted when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it, or for any raid boss caught. These do not stack with each other. Additionally, High and Max Level Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon grant an increased chance to obtain Candy XL when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it.

size_info.description: Ninetales's height ranges from 0.54 m to 2.2 m, with the average being 1.1 m. The illustration shows a comparison with a 1.70 m (5‚Ä≤07‚Ä≥) tall Trainer. Max height has been limited to 450px for rendering purposes.

faq.question: What are Ninetales‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses?
faq.answer: As a Fire-type Pok√©mon, Ninetales is weak to Ground, Rock, and Water-type moves.

faq.question: What are the best moves for Ninetales in Pok√©mon GO?
faq.answer: The best moves for Ninetales in Pok√©mon GO are Fire Spin and Weather Ball. This moveset has a DPS (Damage Per Second) of 10.458 and a TDO (Total Damage Output) of 191.862.

faq.question: How does Ninetales perform in Raids?
faq.answer: Ninetales's Raid attacker tier is currently not known, has no viable moves, or it is too low to be ranked.

faq.question: How does Ninetales rank as a Fire-type attacker?
faq.answer: Ninetales is an F-Tier Fire-type attacker and not recommended for Raid battles.

faq.question: What Mega Pok√©mon boost Ninetales?
faq.answer: The following Mega Pok√©mon boost Ninetales: Mega Houndoom, Mega Blaziken, Mega Camerupt, and Primal Groudon.
